description: Set up the tech stack as Next.js 14+ with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Framer Motion for animations. Configure dark theme with color tokens: bg #050607, surface #0B0F0C, text #EAF2EC, muted #AAB6AE, accent green #2E6B4D, accent soft #3B7A57, border rgba(46,107,77,0.35). Use Inter font. Set up responsive layout with mobile-first design. Include reduced motion preferences detection and dark mode support.

Create a reusable VideoSection component that accepts: background video path, poster image path, overlay color/opacity, content, and sections. Each section should have a full-width HTML5 background video (autoplay, loop, muted, playsInline) with fallback poster image. The video should layer a dark gradient overlay for text readability. Include support for reduced motion (pause videos, show poster). Videos will be lazy-loaded except hero which is preloaded.

Build Hero section with headline 'Your invisible AI co-pilot. On screen. In the moment.' and subheadline covering permission-based screen awareness, live transcription, invisible during screen share. Include primary CTA 'Download for macOS/Windows' and secondary 'Watch it work (30s)'. Add an interactive WOW demo: a split-panel showing 'Your View' and 'Shared View' with a 'Share Screen' toggle that hides the assistant UI from the shared view while keeping it visible on the user's own screen. Label: 'Not captured in screen share'. Use background video /public/videos/01-hero.mp4 with poster /public/videos/01-hero.jpg.

Build Problem section highlighting pain points: 'Missing details in meetings', 'Multitasking vs. focus', 'Manual note-taking', 'Support calls fade from memory', 'Interview moments slip by'. Make it minimal, high-contrast text on dark background with abstract audio wave visuals. Use background video /public/videos/02-problem.mp4 with poster /public/videos/02-problem.jpg.

Build How It Works section with 3 steps: (1) 'Enable permissions - you control everything', (2) 'Panda listens and transcribes - when enabled', (3) 'Panda assists contextually - understanding your workflow'. Use simple icons for each step. Include tiny UI mockups showing Pause, Mute, Screen Scope privacy controls. Make it clear and reassuring about user control. Use background video /public/videos/03-howitworks.mp4 with poster /public/videos/03-howitworks.jpg.

Build Real-Time Transcription section. Include a realistic transcript panel showing streaming text effect (words appearing one by one). Implement 'Smart Highlights' feature where key points turn green (#2E6B4D) and action items appear in a different visual style. Show realistic, believable example (not magical). Keep the demo compact and readable. Use background video /public/videos/04-transcription.mp4 with poster /public/videos/04-transcription.jpg.

Build Screen-Aware Assistance section with 4 use case cards: (1) Sales calls with capture objections, propose follow-up, (2) Interviews with highlight answers, generate summary, (3) Customer support with suggested replies, knowledge snippets, (4) Studying with live captions and notes. Each card should have an icon and short description. Add tagline 'Panda is quiet by default'. Use background video /public/videos/05-screenaware.mp4 with poster /public/videos/05-screenaware.jpg.

Build Invisible During Screen Share section - this is a core differentiator. Create a split-panel comparison: left side 'Your View' shows the assistant overlay visible, right side 'Shared View' shows no overlay (invisible to others). Include animated toggle button 'Share Screen' that switches between views. Add short explanation: 'Designed to keep your presentation clean. Panda stays on your screen only.' Use background video /public/videos/06-screenshare.mp4 with poster /public/videos/06-screenshare.jpg.

Build Privacy & Control section. Create reassuring messaging with concrete details: On/off controls visible in UI, data handling (placeholder: 'On-device where possible; encrypted in transit; you choose what's stored'), clear permissions workflow. Add a 'Trust' indicator row with icons for: 'On-Device Processing', 'Transparent Controls', 'No Background Tracking', 'User Data Ownership'. Use calm, dark design. Use background video /public/videos/07-privacy.mp4 with poster /public/videos/07-privacy.jpg.

Build Pricing section with 3 tiers: (1) Starter - Free - includes live captions, (2) Pro - includes transcription, highlights, smart summaries, (3) Team - includes admin controls, compliance options. Mark as 'Coming soon' if needed. Include comparison feature list. Add email capture form below pricing with validated email input and subscribe button. Include footer with links (About, Contact, Docs, Terms, Privacy), social media icons, and copyright. Use background video /public/videos/08-pricing.mp4 with poster /public/videos/08-pricing.jpg.

Implement smooth scroll animations using Framer Motion: text reveals with staggered effect, panel slides on scroll, opacity transitions. Add 'Panda cursor' hover effect: a soft green glow halo that follows the cursor slowly on interactive elements. Implement 'Panda Mode' easter egg: when user types 'panda' on keyboard, subtly fade in a small panda-mask watermark in the background (keep it tasteful and not obvious). Ensure all animations respect prefers-reduced-motion setting.

Add full accessibility support: semantic HTML5 elements, sufficient color contrast (WCAG AA minimum), visible focus states on all interactive elements, alt text for all images, skip-to-content link. Ensure keyboard navigation works throughout. Test with screen readers. Add proper heading hierarchy (H1, H2, H3). Include lang attribute and meta descriptions.

Optimize for SEO and social sharing: add meta title, description, keywords; include OpenGraph tags (og:title, og:description, og:image, og:type); add Twitter Card tags; ensure meta viewport for mobile. Create proper schema markup if needed. Make the site fully responsive on mobile (375px+), tablet (768px+), and desktop (1024px+). Test layout on common breakpoints. Use mobile-first CSS approach.

Optimize video performance: lazy-load all videos except hero (preload hero video for instant load). Use poster images as fallback. Provide video format suggestions (MP4 H.264, WebM VP8/VP9) with fallbacks. Include comments in code showing where to add real videos (/public/videos/01-hero.mp4, etc.) and poster paths (/public/videos/01-hero.jpg, etc.). Ensure videos don't block initial page load. Add loading states where needed.

Test the full website for responsiveness on mobile, tablet, and desktop. Verify all animations work smoothly. Check video performance and loading times. Test email form validation. Verify reduced motion preferences work correctly. Check all interactive elements have proper focus states. Test on different browsers (Chrome, Safari, Firefox). Ensure footer and pricing section are fully functional. Create a deployment-ready build.

Fix the critical ReferenceError: 'cn is not defined' error in index.tsx. The cn utility function (classname helper) is being used but not imported. Add the missing import statement and ensure the cn utility is properly available throughout the page. This is causing the entire page to crash.

Integrate all 8 generated background videos into the landing page sections. Ensure each VideoSection component has the correct videoSrc and posterSrc paths pointing to the videos in /public/videos/. Verify videos load, loop properly, and display at the correct aspect ratio (16:9, 1920x1080). Test that hero video preloads immediately and other videos lazy-load when sections enter viewport. Ensure fallback posters display correctly on reduced-motion devices. All 8 videos should be playing seamlessly in the background of their respective sections.

Fix video playback issues: ensure all videos in /public/videos/ load and play correctly. Update the VideoSection component to: 1) Add error handling and logging for failed video loads, 2) Ensure autoPlay works with proper muted + playsInline attributes, 3) Add fallback to poster image if video fails to load, 4) Make sure videos loop properly, 5) Test on development server and verify all 8 videos play smoothly in their sections. Debug any CORS, codec, or loading issues.
